How could one pursue a thousand,
and two chase away ten thousand,
unless their Rock had sold them,
and the Lord had handed them over?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, their rock is not like our Rock,
as our enemies themselves recognize.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their vine grows from the vine of Sodom
and from the fields of Gomorrah.
Their grapes are poison grapes.
They have bitter clusters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their wine is burning snake venom
and the deadly poison of cobras.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do I not have all this stored up with me?
Is this not sealed up in my storehouses?
speaker: Narrator

text:
To me belongs vengeance and repayment.
It will come at the time when their foot slips.
Indeed, the day of their disaster is near,
and their impending doom is coming quickly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, the Lord will judge his people,
but he will change his course of action toward his servants
when he sees that their strength is exhausted,
and that there are none left, either as prisoners or still free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he will say:
Where are their gods,
the rock in which they sought refuge,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the gods that ate the fat of their sacrifices
    and drank the wine of their drink offerings?
    Let them rise up and help you.
    Let them be a shelter over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now see that I, only I, am he,
    and there is not a god comparable to me.
    I put to death and I make alive.
    I wound and I heal.
    There is no one who can deliver out of my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I lift up my hand to heaven,
    and I swear: “As I live forever,
speaker: Narrator

text:
if I sharpen the lightning, which is my sword,
    and my hand grabs hold of judgment,
    I will take revenge against my adversaries,
    and I will repay those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
    and my sword will devour flesh
    from the blood of the slain and the captives,
    from the long-haired heads of the enemy.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shout out with a cry of joy, you nations, because of his people,
for he will avenge the blood of his servants,
and he will return vengeance to his adversaries,
but he will atone for the ground, for his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses came along with Hoshea son of Nun and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when Moses had finished speaking all of these words to all Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he also said to them:
“Direct your heart to all the words that I am calling as a witness against you today. Instruct your children with them so that they may be careful to carry out all the words of this law,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is not empty talk for you, because it is your life. By this word you will live long on the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On this same day the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go up to Mount Nebo, this mountain of the Abarim range, which is in the land of Moab opposite Jericho, and view the land of Canaan that I am giving to the people of Israel as a possession,
speaker: Narrator

text: and die on the mountain that you are about to ascend and be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will happen because you broke faith with me among the people of Israel at the waters of Meribah Kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin, by not treating me as holy among the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may view the land from a distance, but you will not go into the land that I am giving to the people of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The following is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the people of Israel before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said:
The Lord came from Sinai,
and from Seir he rose like the sun for them.
He was shining from Mount Paran,
and he came with ten thousand holy ones.
From his right hand a fiery law flew at them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, you love the peoples.
All his holy ones are in your hand.
They are seated at your feet.
Each one rises after hearing your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses commanded a law for us
as a possession for the assembly of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord was King in Jeshurun,
when the heads of the people gathered
together with the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Reuben live and not die,
but may his men be few in number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Judah he said this:
Hear, O Lord, the voice of Judah,
and bring him to his people.
With his own hands he fights for them,
and you will be a help against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Levi he said:
Your Thummim and your Urim belong to your favored man,
whom you tested at Massah,
with whom you contended at the waters of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said about his father and mother,
“I do not recognize them.”
He did not show regard for his own brother.
He did not acknowledge his own children.
Instead he protected your word,
and he guarded your covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Levites will teach your judgments to Jacob.
They will teach your law to Israel.
They will burn incense for you to smell.
They will offer whole offerings upon your altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless, O Lord, his strength,
and accept the work of his hands.
Cripple those who rise against him.
Prevent those who hate him from rising against him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Benjamin he said:
Those loved by the Lord will dwell with him safely.
He will be a canopy over them all day.
They will rest securely against his chest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Joseph he said:
His land is blessed by the Lord:
blessed with the best gifts from the heavens,
blessed with dew and with the deep waters hidden below,
speaker: Narrator

text:
blessed with the best gifts produced by the sun,
blessed with the best gifts yielded by the seasons,
speaker: Narrator

text:
blessed with the best crops from the ancient mountains,
blessed with the best gifts from the everlasting hills,
speaker: Narrator

text:
blessed with the best gifts of the earth and its fullness,
blessed with the favor of the one who was dwelling in
    the burning bush.
May all these come on the head of Joseph,
on the forehead of the one set apart from his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a firstborn bull, he has majesty,
and his horns are the horns of a wild ox.
With them he will gore the peoples,
all the peoples, to the ends of the earth.
Such are the ten thousands of Ephraim.
Such are the thousands of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Zebulun he said:
Rejoice, Zebulun, when you go out.
Rejoice, Issachar, in your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will call people to the mountain.
There they will sacrifice righteous offerings.
Indeed they will nurse on the abundance from the seas
and on the treasures hidden in the sand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Gad he said:
Blessed is the one who enlarges Gad.
Like a lioness he settles down.
He tears off arms and even heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He selected the best portion for himself,
the portion reserved for the ruler.
He came with heads of the people
to carry out the righteousness of the Lord,
to carry out his judgments along with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Dan he said:
Dan is a lion cub.
He leaps out from Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Naphtali he said:
Naphtali is abounding with favor.
He is full of the blessing of the Lord.
Take possession of the west and south.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Concerning Asher he said:
The most blessed of sons is Asher.
May he be pleasing to his brothers.
May he bathe his feet in olive oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your door bolts are iron and bronze.
May your strength be as long-lasting as all your days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no one like the God of Jeshurun,
who rides through the heavens to help you.
In his majesty he rides through the clouds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The everlasting God is a dwelling place,
and his eternal arms are under you.
He drove out the enemy in front of you,
and he said, “Destroy!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So Israel settled down in safety.
Jacob dwelt in security
in a land of grain and fresh wine,
and, yes, its heavens dropped down dew.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are you, O Israel!
Who is like you?
You are a people saved by the Lord,
the shield who gives you help,
the sword who gives you majesty.
Your enemies will come cringing before you,
and you will trample on their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses went up from the Plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, opposite Jericho, and the Lord showed him the whole land: the territory of Gilead as far as Dan,
speaker: Narrator

text: all of Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, the whole land of Judah as far as the Mediterranean Sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Negev, and the Kikkar as far as Zoar (that is, the plain in the valley around Jericho, the City of Palms).
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to him, “This is the land that I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, when I said I will give it to your descendants. I have let you see it with your eyes, but you will not cross over to it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there in the land of Moab as the Lord had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth Peor, but no one knows his burial place to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was one hundred twenty years old at his death. His eyes had not grown dim, and his vigor had not declined.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel wept for Moses in the Arabah of Moab for thirty days. Then the days of weeping and mourning for Moses came to an end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him, so the people of Israel listened to him and did just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Never again has a prophet risen in Israel like Moses, who knew the Lord face-to-face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses performed all the signs and wonders that the Lord sent him to do in the land of Egypt against Pharaoh and against all his officials and his whole land.
speaker: Narrator

text: No other prophet ever displayed all of the mighty power and the great, awesome deeds that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
speaker: Narrator
